TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: told by Giłgiław of Vałulu village

S.FORM: tiaken ti Giłgiław aken.
tiaken ti Giljgiljaw aken.
S.TRANSL: I am Giłgiław.

S.FORM: se Vałulu aken.
se Valjolo aken.
S.TRANSL: of Vałulu village.

S.FORM: sinipuałak aken i Vałulu.
sinipoaljak aken i Valjolo.
S.TRANSL: I was born in Vałulu.

S.FORM: ḍusanga ken a puluq katu sepatj a tsavił tu pinuałakan tjanuaken.
drosanga ken a poloq kato sepatj a cavilj to pinoaljakan tjanoaken.
S.TRANSL: It is 24 years since I was born.

S.FORM: ka tapuluq aken katu sepatj a tsavił sema gaku aken a ventsik.
ka tapoloq aken kato sepatj a cavilj sema gako aken a vencik.
S.TRANSL: When I was 14 I went to school to study.

S.FORM: sepatj aken a tsavił i gaku.
sepatj aken a cavilj i gako.
S.TRANSL: I was 4 years in school.

S.FORM: ka ini anan ka ken a sema gaku napusalasaladj aken tjai kama tjai kina tua sengsengan.
ka ini anan ka ken a sema gako naposalasaladj aken tjai kama tjai kina toa sengsengan.
S.TRANSL: Before I went to school I helped my father and mother in their (field) work.

S.FORM: ka i gaku anan aken matsay ti kama.
ka i gako anan aken macay ti kama.
S.TRANSL: When I was still at school my father died.

S.FORM: qau ti kaka itua kuaping.
qao ti kaka itoa koaping.
S.TRANSL: My elder brother was in the army.

S.FORM: qau ti kina izua ałak a lumamad.
qao ti kina izoa aljak a lomamad.
S.TRANSL: My mother had very young children.

S.FORM: izua ku kaka kakeḍian anan a maḍusa, ini anan ka makaya masengseng.
izoa ko kaka kakedrian anan a madrosa, ini anan ka makaya masengseng.
S.TRANSL: My two siblings were still children, not yet able to work.

S.FORM: nasemalimsim tuazua tia kina.
nasemalimsim toazoa tia kina.
S.TRANSL: My mother and the children were very badly off.

S.FORM: mana ku sinikitjaula i gaku.
mana ko sinikitjaola i gako.
S.TRANSL: That is why I left school.

S.FORM: salimsim aken tjaia kina tua mareka ku kaka.
salimsim aken tjaia kina toa mareka ko kaka.
S.TRANSL: I had pity on my mother and my siblings.

S.FORM: neka nu muri paquzip.
neka no mori paqozip.
S.TRANSL: There was noone to provide for them.

S.FORM: qau tuazua naselapay aken tua nia sengsengan.
qao toazoa naselapay aken toa nia sengsengan.
S.TRANSL: I had a bad time then working for us.

S.FORM: matsidił aken tua ku kemudanga.
macidilj aken toa ko kemodanga.
S.TRANSL: I had to do everything on my own.

S.FORM: malułay aken aravats.
maloljay aken aravac.
S.TRANSL: I was very tired.

S.FORM: łakua nu ika ken a masengseng, neka nu kanen nia kina nua mareka ku kaka.
ljakoa no ika ken a masengseng, neka no kanen nia kina noa mareka ko kaka.
S.TRANSL: But if I didn’t work there would be no food for my mother and my siblings.

S.FORM: qau kipaqadił aken a masengseng ta ku sipaquzip tjaia kina tua mareka ku kaka, patje mangtjez ti kaka a nakisan kuaping.
qao kipaqadilj aken a masengseng ta ko sipaqozip tjaia kina toa mareka ko kaka, patje mangtjez ti kaka a nakisan koaping.
S.TRANSL: So I put up with working to provide for my mother and my siblings, until my elder brother came back from the army.

S.FORM: ka mangtjez anga ti kaka a nakisan kuaping, izuanga pusaladj tjanuaken tua nia sengsengan.
ka mangtjez anga ti kaka a nakisan koaping, izoanga posaladj tjanoaken toa nia sengsengan.
S.TRANSL: When my brother had come back from the army there was someone to help me with our work.

S.FORM: lima ken a tsavił a masengseng a matsidił, sa pangtjengtjez ti kaka, saka izuanga ku saladj a masengseng.
lima ken a cavilj a masengseng a macidilj, sa pangtjengtjez ti kaka, saka izoanga ko saladj a masengseng.
S.TRANSL: I did the work on my own for 5 years; then my brother came, and I had a companion in the work.

S.FORM: ka mangtjez anga ti kaka, keḍi anga a ku sengsengan.
ka mangtjez anga ti kaka, kedri anga a ko sengsengan.
S.TRANSL: When my brother came back, there was less work for me.

S.FORM: ika ken a malułay anga.
ika ken a maloljay anga.
S.TRANSL: I wasn’t tired out.

S.FORM: makayanga ken a kivala sema tjuqała, izua i Pałul, i Payuan, i Qutsapungan, sema Takaw.
makayanga ken a kivala sema tjoqalja, izoa i Paljol, i Payoan, i Qocapongan, sema Takaw.
S.TRANSL: I could go off for fun to other places-to Pałul, Payuan, Qutsapungan, and to Takao (Kaohsiung).

S.FORM: namasengsengseng aken i Takaw a kipaisu.
namasengsengseng aken i Takaw a kipaiso.
S.TRANSL: I worked in Takao to earn money.

S.FORM: ku siveli tua ku itung.
ko siveli toa ko itong.
S.TRANSL: With it I bought clothes.

S.FORM: ka izuanga ku itung, vaik anga ken a sema umaq; sa ku paitungi anga tia kina a mareka ku kaka.
ka izoanga ko itong, vaik anga ken a sema omaq; sa ko paitongi anga tia kina a mareka ko kaka.
S.TRANSL: When I had got some clothes I went back home; and I gave clothes to my mother and my siblings.

S.FORM: maleva ravats.
maleva ravac.
S.TRANSL: They were very pleased.

S.FORM: tu ku sinaTakavan navenli aken tua ku itung.
to ko sinaTakavan navenli aken toa ko itong.
S.TRANSL: Every time I went to Takao I bought clothes.

S.FORM: maleva ravats ti kina.
maleva ravac ti kina.
S.TRANSL: My mother was very pleased.

S.FORM: łakua tiaken nakuya ken aravats.
ljakoa tiaken nakoya ken aravac.
S.TRANSL: But I was very bad.

S.FORM: ku djinukul anga ti kina a ku kaka.
ko djinokol anga ti kina a ko kaka.
S.TRANSL: I hit my mother and my siblings.

S.FORM: nakuya ken aravats.
nakoya ken aravac.
S.TRANSL: I was very bad.

S.FORM: łakua tutsu tu ku kinasinzian inika ken a djemukudjukul anga.
ljakoa toco to ko kinasinzian inika ken a djemokodjokol anga.
S.TRANSL: But now since becoming a believer I don’t hit people any more.

S.FORM: lemangdanga ken tua tulu nua Tsemas.
lemangdanga ken toa tolo noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: Now I listen to the teaching of God.

S.FORM: kisamułanga ken a semupu tua siisiu.
kisamoljanga ken a semopo toa siisio.
S.TRANSL: I read the Bible frequently.

S.FORM: qau kemłang aken tua kiłivak tua tja kina tua timaimanga.
qao kemljang aken toa kiljivak toa tja kina toa timaimanga.
S.TRANSL: I know about loving our mothers and everyone.

S.FORM: ka sangasangasan kisan sinzia zua ku kaka maḍusa, sanaka ti kina.
ka sangasangasan kisan sinzia zoa ko kaka madrosa, sanaka ti kina.
S.TRANSL: At first my two siblings became believers, and then my mother.

S.FORM: "kaka," aya zua ku kaka, "kisan sinzia-u.
"kaka," aya zoa ko kaka, "kisan sinzia-o.
S.TRANSL: My siblings said to me: “Brother, become a believer.

S.FORM: nanguaq aravats.
nangoaq aravac.
S.TRANSL: It’s very good.

S.FORM: inika tjen a marivurivu anga.
inika tjen a marivorivo anga.
S.TRANSL: We don’t quarrel any more.

S.FORM: ika tjen a tsemakatsakaw anga.
ika tjen a cemakacakaw anga.
S.TRANSL: We don’t steal.

S.FORM: nu matsay itjen vaik itjen a sema tjarivavaw, aya za tulu tjanuamen.
no macay itjen vaik itjen a sema tjarivavaw, aya za tolo tjanoamen.
S.TRANSL: We are taught that when we die we go to heaven.

S.FORM: nekanga nu tja pasalisaliw nu kisan sinzia itjen.
nekanga no tja pasalisaliw no kisan sinzia itjen.
S.TRANSL: We have no more sins when we become believers.

S.FORM: qau kisan sinzia-u.
qao kisan sinzia-o.
S.TRANSL: Become a believer.

S.FORM: nanguaq aravats.
nangoaq aravac.
S.TRANSL: It’s very good.

S.FORM: uła masualap a su pasalisaliw."
olja masoalap a so pasalisaliw."
S.TRANSL: And your sins will be taken away.”

S.FORM: pasemalavan aken nua ku kaka tua tulu nua Tsemas.
pasemalavan aken noa ko kaka toa tolo noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: My siblings told me the teaching of God.

S.FORM: inika ken a masalu.
inika ken a masalo.
S.TRANSL: I didn’t believe.

S.FORM: łakua ku patsunan a sikudan nua ku kaka.
ljakoa ko paconan a sikodan noa ko kaka.
S.TRANSL: But I noticed my siblings’ behaviour.

S.FORM: inika marivurivu anga.
inika marivorivo anga.
S.TRANSL: They didn’t quarrel any more.

S.FORM: nu mangtjez a kasi gaku, vaik a tsałum, vaik a kitsatsevung.
no mangtjez a kasi gako, vaik a caljom, vaik a kicacevong.
S.TRANSL: When they came back from school, they went to get water or went to meet people (coming back laden from the fields).

S.FORM: kilangdanga aravats tua nia tulu.
kilangdanga aravac toa nia tolo.
S.TRANSL: They were very obedient to what we told them.

S.FORM: patsun aken tua sikudan.
pacon aken toa sikodan.
S.TRANSL: I noticed their behaviour.

S.FORM: paquliqulid kaumaya, aya ken.
paqoliqolid kaomaya, aya ken.
S.TRANSL: I thought that perhaps what they said was true.

S.FORM: saqetju a ku varung, ka kinemnem anga ken.
saqetjo a ko varong, ka kinemnem anga ken.
S.TRANSL: This disturbed me when I thought about it.

S.FORM: izua zua qinaruqarut a sunat a sinipavay tua zua mareka ku kaka.
izoa zoa qinaroqarot a sonat a sinipavay toa zoa mareka ko kaka.
S.TRANSL: My siblings had been given some booklets that were distributed.

S.FORM: ka vaik a sema gaku, ku alapen azua sunat, sa ku supu-i.
ka vaik a sema gako, ko alapen azoa sonat, sa ko sopo-i.
S.TRANSL: When they had gone to school, I took the booklets and read them.

S.FORM: "kiłivaki tua tja matjałałak.
"kiljivaki toa tja matjaljaljak.
S.TRANSL: What I read was: “We should love our parents.

S.FORM: nakuya qemtsi tua tsautsau.
nakoya qemci toa caocao.
S.TRANSL: We should not kill people,

S.FORM: nakuya padjumak.
nakoya padjomak.
S.TRANSL: fornicate,

S.FORM: nakuya tsemakaw.
nakoya cemakaw.
S.TRANSL: steal.

S.FORM: nakuya qauban.
nakoya qaoban.
S.TRANSL: or envy others.

S.FORM: kiłivaku tua nu łaqediqedi," aya zua ku sinupu.
kiljivako toa no ljaqediqedi," aya zoa ko sinopo.
S.TRANSL: Love your neighbours.”

S.FORM: izua zua ku sinupu: "timun parekiłivałivaku," aya zua ku sinupu.
izoa zoa ko sinopo: "timon parekiljivaljivako," aya zoa ko sinopo.
S.TRANSL: Another thing I read was: “Love one another.”

S.FORM: izua zua masanitał uta: "tiaken namatsay aken sa ke kamevałut.
izoa zoa masanitalj ota: "tiaken namacay aken sa ke kamevaljot.
S.TRANSL: One more thing I read was: “I was dead and came back to life.

S.FORM: tiaken djalan aken, kaqulidan, nasi aken.
tiaken djalan aken, kaqolidan, nasi aken.
S.TRANSL: I am the way, the truth and the life.

S.FORM: a kisusu tjanuaken nuka matsay tjara ku papevałuten," aya zua ku sinupu, sa ke kasalu anga.
a kisoso tjanoaken noka macay tjara ko papevaljoten," aya zoa ko sinopo, sa ke kasalo anga.
S.TRANSL: Anyone who follows me, even if they die I will bring them back to life”. That was what I read, and I believed.

S.FORM: łakua masiaq aken a semukub, tua ku qinaqivuivuan tua mareka sinzia.
ljakoa masiaq aken a semokob, toa ko qinaqivoivoan toa mareka sinzia.
S.TRANSL: But I was ashamed to attend worship because of what I had said about believers.

S.FORM: łakua ka tsuatsuay anga kidjaladjalan anga ken a semukub tua ku tsemekemekeł.
ljakoa ka coacoay anga kidjaladjalan anga ken a semokob toa ko cemekemekelj.
S.TRANSL: But after a time I did accompany my family to worship.

S.FORM: qau kisamułanga ken a kiqepu tua sinzia, sa ke kełang anga tua kakudan nua sinzia.
qao kisamoljanga ken a kiqepo toa sinzia, sa ke keljang anga toa kakodan noa sinzia.
S.TRANSL: Then I frequently attended the believers’ meetings, and I understood the believers’ ways.

S.FORM: "iya manu kemudanga," aya ken.
"iya mano kemodanga," aya ken.
S.TRANSL: “So that’s the way it is,”I said to myself.

S.FORM: samałi anga ken.
samalji anga ken.
S.TRANSL: I was surprised.

S.FORM: kana liguligu anga ken, sa ke ka kisan sinzia a kirimu, kana ken a matsaqu anga, kana ken a kemłang anga," ayanga ken a kinemnem.
kana ligoligo anga ken, sa ke ka kisan sinzia a kirimo, kana ken a macaqo anga, kana ken a kemljang anga," ayanga ken a kinemnem.
S.TRANSL: “If only I had known and become a believer sooner. Then I would have been good at doing things and would have understood,”I thought.

S.FORM: patełip aken aravats tua ika ku kinasinzian a kirimu.
pateljip aken aravac toa ika ko kinasinzian a kirimo.
S.TRANSL: I greatly regretted that I hadn’t become a believer sooner.

S.FORM: łakua ka kisan sinzia aken kisamułanga ken aravats a kisusu.
ljakoa ka kisan sinzia aken kisamoljanga ken aravac a kisoso.
S.TRANSL: But when I became a believer I was a very zealous practising believer.

S.FORM: qau pai ka tsuatsuay anga ken tua ku kinasinzian, kinemnem anga ken tua ku vaik a tjemautsikel, sa ke vaik anga sema tjuqała a pasemalamalaw tua kiłivak tua pitsul nua Tsemas.
qao pai ka coacoay anga ken toa ko kinasinzian, kinemnem anga ken toa ko vaik a tjemaocikel, sa ke vaik anga sema tjoqalja a pasemalamalaw toa kiljivak toa picol noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: Some time after I had become a believer I thought of going to tell others, and I went to other villages to tell people about the love and power of God.

S.FORM: ka patagił vaik aken a sema Makazayazaya a pasemalaw tua kai nua Tsemas.
ka patagilj vaik aken a sema Makazayazaya a pasemalaw toa kai noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: First I went to Makazayazaya to tell them about the word of God.

S.FORM: łakua inika kemłang.
ljakoa inika kemljang.
S.TRANSL: But they didn’t understand.

S.FORM: ka ku sipakatjelutjeluł kemłang anga tua tulu nua Tsemas.
ka ko sipakatjelotjelolj kemljang anga toa tolo noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: After my third visit they understood the teaching of God.

S.FORM: qau kisan sinzianga azua tatsekełan; saka metjuruvu anga.
qao kisan sinzianga azoa tacekeljan; saka metjorovo anga.
S.TRANSL: One family became believers; and later more people did so.

S.FORM: qau nu makapitjuł vaik aken a sema Makazayazaya.
qao no makapitjolj vaik aken a sema Makazayazaya.
S.TRANSL: Every week I went to Makazayazaya.

S.FORM: makatjeluł aken makasimatjeł aken i Makazayazaya a pasemalamalaw tua tulu nua Tsemas.
makatjelolj aken makasimatjelj aken i Makazayazaya a pasemalamalaw toa tolo noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: I stayed in Makazayazaya 3 or 4 days telling them the teaching of God.

S.FORM: tatsavił aken katu izua łemules a pasemalamalaw tua tulu nua Tsemas.
tacavilj aken kato izoa ljemoles a pasemalamalaw toa tolo noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: For over a year I continued telling them the teaching of God.

S.FORM: man alu a puluq aza sinzia.
man alo a poloq aza sinzia.
S.TRANSL: There were 80 believers.

S.FORM: łakua ku putideqan a tjelu a qiłas.
ljakoa ko potideqan a tjelo a qiljas.
S.TRANSL: But then I didn’t go for 3 months;

S.FORM: kitjaula zua man ḍusa puluq.
kitjaola zoa man drosa poloq.
S.TRANSL: and 20 of them gave up.

S.FORM: qau mangtjez azua kemasi Karinku a naventsik, vaik anga sema Makazayazaya a zemang tua zua sinzia.
qao mangtjez azoa kemasi Karinko a navencik, vaik anga sema Makazayazaya a zemang toa zoa sinzia.
S.TRANSL: Then someone came back from studying at Karenko (Hualien), and went to Makazayazaya to look after the believers.

S.FORM: qau vaik anga ken a pasa tjuzuma a tjemautsikel tua kai nua Tsemas.
qao vaik anga ken a pasa tjozoma a tjemaocikel toa kai noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: So I went to other places to tell them the word of God.

S.FORM: kasi Masilid anga ken, kasi Djaładjałay anga ken a tjemautsiketsikel tua kai nua Tsemas.
kasi Masilid anga ken, kasi Djaljadjaljay anga ken a tjemaocikecikel toa kai noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: I went to Masilid and Djaładjałay to tell them the word of God.

S.FORM: nuka mayanga qudjał, nuka mayanga vali, tjara vaik aken a sema Makazayazaya.
noka mayanga qodjalj, noka mayanga vali, tjara vaik aken a sema Makazayazaya.
S.TRANSL: However rainy or windy it was I always went to Makazyazaya.

S.FORM: nuka mayanga tsadjan, nu tjału zuanga tua ku sisazuan, tjara vaik aken.
noka mayanga cadjan, no tjaljo zoanga toa ko sisazoan, tjara vaik aken.
S.TRANSL: However far it was, when the time came for me to go I always went.

S.FORM: nu zemuker aken i Makazayazaya, puqarut aken a maka puḍipungan a pasemalaw tua taizin: "sinsi, uri pasemalaw aken tua kai nua Tsemas."
no zemoker aken i Makazayazaya, poqarot aken a maka podripongan a pasemalaw toa taizin: "sinsi, ori pasemalaw aken toa kai noa Cemas."
S.TRANSL: When I arrived in Makazayazaya I went straight round to the police station to tell the officer: “Sir, I’m going to preach the word of God.”

S.FORM: "ainu a su vetsik a kemasi Alikang?
"aino a so vecik a kemasi Alikang?
S.TRANSL: “Where is your permit from the Alikang police station?

S.FORM: kasi gaku sun?" ayain aken.
kasi gako son?" ayain aken.
S.TRANSL: Are you a (?Bible school) graduate?” said the officer to me.

S.FORM: nuka ika nemanema siqaqivu tjanuaken.
noka ika nemanema siqaqivo tjanoaken.
S.TRANSL: That was said to me without any reason.

S.FORM: łakua ika ken a natemvela tua nemanema.
ljakoa ika ken a natemvela toa nemanema.
S.TRANSL: But I didn’t reply at all.

S.FORM: tuazua masulem anga, qudjaqudjałan.
toazoa masolem anga, qodjaqodjaljan.
S.TRANSL: It was getting dark, and it was the rainy season.

S.FORM: masepaqudjał aken i djalan.
masepaqodjalj aken i djalan.
S.TRANSL: I had got rained on on the way.

S.FORM: nuka mayanga ku łałeqeran, inika ken a sauin a kirimu.
noka mayanga ko ljaljeqeran, inika ken a saoin a kirimo.
S.TRANSL: Although I was very cold, I wasn’t allowed to go quickly.

S.FORM: nuka ika nemanema, siqaqivu tjanuaken a paqeteleng.
noka ika nemanema, siqaqivo tjanoaken a paqeteleng.
S.TRANSL: I was abused without any reason for it.

S.FORM: inika ken a paqiladjen.
inika ken a paqiladjen.
S.TRANSL: I wasn’t given a seat.

S.FORM: nu salilim anga sauin anga ken a pasa qinałan.
no salilim anga saoin anga ken a pasa qinaljan.
S.TRANSL: It was late at night when I was allowed to go to the village.

S.FORM: mayanga qudjał, mayanga selemanan.
mayanga qodjalj, mayanga selemanan.
S.TRANSL: In spite of the rain and the darkness,

S.FORM: ika ken a pasedjaman tua łaung, ika ken a sisan sapui.
ika ken a pasedjaman toa ljaong, ika ken a sisan sapoi.
S.TRANSL: I wasn’t lent anything to keep off the rain and I wasn’t given a torch.

S.FORM: "sa-u," ayain aken.
"sa-o," ayain aken.
S.TRANSL: I was just told to go.

S.FORM: ika manu amin.
ika mano amin.
S.TRANSL: That’s not all.

S.FORM: tua ku sisazuan anga, ika manu kinmusał ika manu kintjeluł, maya tuazua tua ku sisazuan anga.
toa ko sisazoan anga, ika mano kinmosalj ika mano kintjelolj, maya toazoa toa ko sisazoan anga.
S.TRANSL: Whenever I went there, not just twice or three times, it was the same every time.

S.FORM: ika manu amin a i puḍipungan.
ika mano amin a i podripongan.
S.TRANSL: It wasn’t only at the police station.

S.FORM: nu sema qinałan aken, qaqivuin aken a paqeteleng.
no sema qinaljan aken, qaqivoin aken a paqeteleng.
S.TRANSL: When I went to the village I was abused.

S.FORM: pai namaya tutsu a ku siselapay.
pai namaya toco a ko siselapay.
S.TRANSL: That was the way I suffered.

S.FORM: nu vaik itjen a tjemautsikel tua kai nua Tsemas, tjara izua tja siselapayan.
no vaik itjen a tjemaocikel toa kai noa Cemas, tjara izoa tja siselapayan.
S.TRANSL: When we go to tell the word of God, there are always times when we suffer.

S.FORM: łakua paparangez itjen sakamaya tua Tsemas i vavaw.
ljakoa paparangez itjen sakamaya toa Cemas i vavaw.
S.TRANSL: But we just trust God above.

S.FORM: nu kinemnem itjen tua kinipakezkezan ni Yisu-sama tua siselapay, paparangez itjen sakamaya tua tja siselapay.
no kinemnem itjen toa kinipakezkezan ni Yiso-sama toa siselapay, paparangez itjen sakamaya toa tja siselapay.
S.TRANSL: When we think of the suffering of Jesus in his crucifixion, we just trust God in our suffering.
